      • prioritize

        public scala.collection.immutable.List<BlockManagerId> prioritize(BlockManagerId blockManagerId,
                                                         scala.collection.Seq<BlockManagerId> peers,
                                                         scala.collection.mutable.HashSet<BlockManagerId> peersReplicatedTo,
                                                         BlockId blockId,
                                                         int numReplicas)
        Method to prioritize a bunch of candidate peers of a block. This is a basic implementation, that just makes sure we put blocks on different hosts, if possible

        Specified by:
        prioritize in interface BlockReplicationPolicy
        Parameters:
        blockManagerId - Id of the current BlockManager for self identification
        peers - A list of peers of a BlockManager
        peersReplicatedTo - Set of peers already replicated to
        blockId - BlockId of the block being replicated. This can be used as a source of randomness if needed.
        numReplicas - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        A prioritized list of peers. Lower the index of a peer, higher its priority
